paper_title: Synergistic effects of surface Lewis Base/Acid and nitrogen defect in MgAl layered double Oxides/Carbon nitride heterojunction for efficient photoreduction of carbon dioxide

catalyst.source: Here, we construct a MgAl layered double oxide/nitrogen-deficient carbon nitride (MgAl LDO/N v -CN) nanosheets hybrid by in situ deposition of MgAl layered double hydroxide (MgAl LDH) on N v -CN nanosheets followed by subsequent calcination.
catalyst.context: Conversion of CO 2 to CO from solar energy on semiconductors is a promising route to renewable energy, but their practicality is limited by the poor adsorption and activation of CO 2 on the semiconductor surface and the low utilization of photovoltaic carriers.Here, we construct a MgAl layered double oxide/nitrogen-deficient carbon nitride (MgAl LDO/N v -CN) nanosheets hybrid by in situ deposition of MgAl layered double hydroxide (MgAl LDH) on N v -CN nanosheets followed by subsequent calcination.The MgAl LDO serves as the surface-rich Lewis basic sites to effectively enhance adsorption of CO 2 and H 2 O, while the nitrogen defects can enhance the optical absorption of g-C 3 N 4 and improve the charge carrier separation.The optimal MgAl LDO/N v -CN has high photocatalytic activity for CO 2 reduction with a CO generation rate of 20.47 molg -1 h -1 under visible light illumination, which is 6 times higher than that of bulk g-C 3 N 4 .Our work highlights the significance of synergy of MgAl LDO Lewis base/acid sites and nitrogen vacancy defects in the design of efficient photocatalysts for CO 2 reduction.

catalyst.context: In summary, we have prepared 2D/2D MgAl LDO/N v -CN heterojunction photocatalysts with abundant Lewis base/acid sites and nitrogen defects through in-situ deposition and subsequent calcination.The MgAl LDO surface has abundant Lewis acid-base sites such as O 2-, Mg 2 -O 2-pairs, OH -, Al 3 and Al 3 -O 2-pairs, of which the Lewis base sites (O 2-, Mg 2 -O 2-pairs, OH -) effectively enhance the adsorption of CO 2 by the catalyst, while the Lewis acid sites (Al 3 and Al 3 -O 2-pairs) enhance the adsorption/dissociation of H 2 O.Moreover, the presence of the nitrogen defect helps to expand the light absorption range of g-C 3 N 4 and promotes carrier separation to raise enough electrons for the reduction reaction.The 10 MgAl LDO/N v -CN sample has a CO evolution rate high up to 20.47 molg -1 h -1 , which was 6 times higher than that of CN (3.38 molg -1 h -1 ), and higher than that reported for the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 most g-C 3 N 4 -based catalysts.It is proposed that defect engineering and surface modification of Lewis basic and acidic sites working in concert is an effective strategy to enhance photocatalytic activity of CO 2 reduction. the CO 2 reduction activity of Al 2 O 3 /N v -CN was significantly lower than that of N v -CN, indicating that Al-O bond were not the adsorption and activation sites for CO 2 .In contrast, MgO/N v -CN showed a high photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity, demonstrating that MgO was the active sites for the CO 2 adsorption and activation.Meanwhile, the activity of MgO-Al 2 O 3 / N v -CN was slightly may be related to the synergistic effect of MgO and Al 2 O 3 in MgAl LDO.In particular, the low-coordinated O 2-in Mg-O can promote the adsorption and activation of CO 2 , and the coordinated unsaturated AI 3 can promote the adsorption and dissociation of H 2 O, while this effect is only present in MgAl LDO and not in the mixed oxides of MgO and Al 2 O 3 .To understand the relationship between MgAl LDO and N v -CN, the CO 2 reduction activities of 10 MgAl LDH/N v -CN, 10 MgAl LDO/CN and physically mixed MgAl LDO and N v -CN (M-MgAl LDO/N v -CN) were compared under the same conditions.The MgAl LDH/N v -CN exhibited a higher activity than N v -CN, which may be due to the formation of a heterojunction structure between MgAl LDH and N v -CN.The M-MgAl LDO/N v -CN was much less active than N v -CN, suggesting that a tight contact between MgAl LDO and N v -CN must exist to achieve efficient CO 2 reduction.Compared with CN, the CO 2 reduction activity of 10 MgAl LDO/CN was increased, which was caused by the enhanced CO 2 adsorption from the surface Lewis base of MgAl LDO.However, the CO 2 reduction activity of 10 MgAl LDO/CN was much lower than that of 10 MgAl LDO/N v -CN, probably because MgAl LDO is an adsorption site rather than a catalytic site for the CO 2 reduction reaction.Therefore, it is hypothesized that the enhanced MgAl LDO/N v -CN activity should result from the multiple synergistic effects of the nitrogen defect and MgAl LDO.Furthermore, C-N v -CN was obtained without the addition of MgAl LDH during the synthesis of MgAl LDO/N v -CN, and the activity of C-N v -CN for the reduction of CO 2 did not change significantly compared to that of N v -CN, indicating that the synergistic effect of MgAl LDO and nitrogen defects in MgAl LDO/N v -CN is the main factor causing the increased activity of N v -CN. operation mode.context: In summary, we have prepared 2D/2D MgAl LDO/N v -CN heterojunction photocatalysts with abundant Lewis base/acid sites and nitrogen defects through in-situ deposition and subsequent calcination.The MgAl LDO surface has abundant Lewis acid-base sites such as O 2-, Mg 2 -O 2-pairs, OH -, Al 3 and Al 3 -O 2-pairs, of which the Lewis base sites (O 2-, Mg 2 -O 2-pairs, OH -) effectively enhance the adsorption of CO 2 by the catalyst, while the Lewis acid sites (Al 3 and Al 3 -O 2-pairs) enhance the adsorption/dissociation of H 2 O.Moreover, the presence of the nitrogen defect helps to expand the light absorption range of g-C 3 N 4 and promotes carrier separation to raise enough electrons for the reduction reaction.The 10 MgAl LDO/N v -CN sample has a CO evolution rate high up to 20.47 molg -1 h -1 , which was 6 times higher than that of CN (3.38 molg -1 h -1 ), and higher than that reported for the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 most g-C 3 N 4 -based catalysts.It is proposed that defect engineering and surface modification of Lewis basic and acidic sites working in concert is an effective strategy to enhance photocatalytic activity of CO 2 reduction. showed a high photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity, demonstrating that MgO was the active sites for the CO 2 adsorption and activation.Meanwhile, the activity of MgO-Al 2 O 3 / N v -CN was slightly lower than that of MgO/N v -CN, further demonstrating that Al-O bond was unfavorable for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.The activity of MgAl LDO/N v -CN was much higher than that of MgO/N v -CN, which may be related to the synergistic effect of MgO and Al 2 O 3 in MgAl LDO.In particular, the low-coordinated O 2-in Mg-O can promote the adsorption and activation of CO 2 , and the coordinated unsaturated AI 3 can promote the adsorption and dissociation of H 2 O, while this effect is only present in MgAl LDO and not in the mixed oxides of MgO and Al 2 O 3 .To understand the relationship between MgAl LDO and N v -CN, the CO 2 reduction activities of 10 MgAl LDH/N v -CN, 10 MgAl LDO/CN and physically mixed MgAl LDO and N v -CN (M-MgAl LDO/N v -CN) were compared under the same conditions.The MgAl LDH/N v -CN exhibited a higher activity than N v -CN, which may be due to the formation of a heterojunction structure between MgAl LDH and N v -CN.The M-MgAl LDO/N v -CN was much less active than N v -CN, suggesting that a tight contact between MgAl LDO and N v -CN must exist to achieve efficient CO 2 reduction.Compared with CN, the CO 2 reduction activity of 10 MgAl LDO/CN was increased, which was caused by the enhanced CO 2 adsorption from the surface Lewis base of MgAl LDO.However, the CO 2 reduction activity of 10 MgAl LDO/CN was much lower than that of 10 MgAl LDO/N v -CN, probably because MgAl LDO is an adsorption site rather than a catalytic site for the CO 2 reduction reaction.Therefore, it is hypothesized that the enhanced MgAl LDO/N v -CN activity should result from the multiple synergistic effects of the nitrogen defect and MgAl LDO.Furthermore, C-N v -CN was obtained without the addition of MgAl LDH during the synthesis of MgAl LDO/N v -CN, and the activity of C-N v -CN for the reduction of CO 2 did not change significantly compared to that of N v -CN, indicating that the synergistic effect of MgAl LDO and nitrogen defects in MgAl LDO/N v -CN is the main factor causing the increased activity of N v -CN.
